comment: You would have to be a complete idiot to not pass this class. This class is such a easy A. and Prof. Gardner gives great lectures. The grades are based on 10% attendance , 45% midterm and the final which is 45% as well. The exam questions are straight off of the power points which he posts on D2L. Super easy. I would definitely take him again.

Attendance is 10% of your grade. He takes it randomly. I never was there when he took attendance and still passed the class. No textbook needed for this class. All his test come straight from his powerpoint. Also all powerpoints are posted on D2L.

His class consists of three things: midterm (45%), final (45%) and participation(10%). Although those two tests hold a lot of weight, they are the easiest tests. The content on the test is exactly copy and paste off the PowerPoints. I would 12/10 take him again if I needed to. I wouldn't take this class if you actually need to know the material.
Only 2 tests but they were easy. attendance is 10 % of the grade but all he does is read powerpoints generally easy. Just show up and listen. Tests were easy

You NEED to go to class. The lectures are a waste of time, but he will randomly take roll and if your not there you will lose attendance points. 10% of your grade is strictly attendance so just go to class. If you take his 2 and a half hour class he will let you out an hour early every time. Super easy tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Such an easy government class. Two tests and participation make up your grade. Two tests might sound scary, but in reality, he copies and pastes from the powerpoint lectures. I learned some new stuff but most of it was common sense.
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He's super easy. The only assignments that we had were the midterm which was 40% and the final which also was 40%. You don't have to go to class.

Honestly this is the easiest class i've ever taken. No homework, or quizzes. No textbook. He says attendance isn't mandatory but he does take roll at random times and uses that for your participation grade. Your final grade is determined by a mid-term (40%), final (40%) and participation (10%). Midterm and final come straight from the powerpoint.

There is only a midterm and final but don't let that scare you! It is very simple and straightforward. He doesn't try to trick you because he knows most of the students in the class are not POLS majors. Classes can be boring but most of the time he lets us out 15-20 minutes early.

Professor Gardner knew a lot about the subject at hand and you could tell he enjoys teaching it. He's also very personable and understands that students take the course because they have to; that said, he doesn't require that you purchase the book and even says that you have to try to fail his class. Would definitely recommend.

This class was extremely easy. There are 3 grades. 40% midterm, 40% final, 10% attendance on random occasions. canceled class a few times which was nice. His tests were straight from his power points that he posts on his D2L. I would definitely take him again

This guy is great. I like his joking personality. His class has been as follows: Look at one or two sometimes three slideshows on each chapter, then leave class. We have two grades in the class total: the mid term and final. Thats it. The tests are verbatim by the slides which he posts online. We only meet once a week on Friday. Its easy, take him

My class meets only once a week which makes it feel like that we are not in class much. He only gives a midterm and a final and those are the only two grades he ever puts in the gradebook so not a lot of chances to boost your grade if you do bad on one. One time he cancelled class and offered extra credit did not email us to let us know everything.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS
